results.title: Recurrence of unilateral angioedema of the tongue: A case report
results.text_hl: She had a history of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@ for 32 years and had been receiving 20 mg/d of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ for 32 years.

citations.NLM: Matsuhisa Y, Kenzaka T, Shimizu H, Hirose H, Gotoh T. Recurrence of unilateral angioedema of the tongue: A case report World J Clin Cases. 2023 Sep 26;11(27):6603-6612. PMID: 37900225

results.title: Acute pancreatitis associated with combined lisinopril and atorvastatin therapy.
results.text_hl: A 86-year-old man with long-standing history of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@, who was treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 10 mg and @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ 20 mg once daily presented with @DISEASE_Pancreatitis @DISEASE_MESH:D010195 @@@acute pancreatitis@@@.

citations.NLM: Kanbay M, Sekuk H, Yilmaz U, Gur G, Boyacioglu S. Acute pancreatitis associated with combined lisinopril and atorvastatin therapy. Dig Dis. 2005;23(1):92-4. PMID: 15920330

results.title: Diagnosis and management of carbon monoxide poisoning in the emergency department.
results.text_hl: She has a past medical history of "well-controlled" @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@, and @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@non-insulin-dependent diabetes@@@.
